VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the agency's
budget and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 04/16/2024. The previous
interim audit was completed in 2023 and no CAP was required. The agency
started using a new HR Software System in 2023 and they will be implementing
new procedures to enhance timeliness of employee performance evaluations.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling very supported by management, having the
necessary training and tools to provide care and supervision for the youths in the
program and expressed no concerns regarding the agency.
The Agency currently has one youth and youth was in school during the onsite
inspection, therefore youth was not interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a short-term shelter type residential one-story home with a
basement. It has a living room, dining room, kitchen, bathroom, and two bedrooms
with three beds in each bedroom. The facility was found to be clean, neat, and
appropriate. There were no issues of concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
